analyzeResult.content:
CHERYL A. DYER, Ph.D.
Associate Professor
University of California at San Diego, La Jolla, CA University of California at San Diego, La Jolla, CA
B.A.
9/70-6/74
Biology
Ph.D.
9/80-6/86
Physiology/Pharmacol.
EMPLOYMENT:
1974-1980
Staff Research Associate, Department of Medicine, UCSD, La Jolla, CA
1986-1989
Postdoctoral Research Fellow, Department of Immunology, Research Institute of Scripps Clinic, La Jolla, CA
1989-1990
Senior Research Associate, Department of Immunology, The Scripps Research Institute, La Jolla, CA
1990-1995
Assistant Member, Department of Immunology, The Scripps Research Institute, La Jolla, CA
1995-Present
Associate Professor, Department of Biological Sci., Northern Arizona Univ., Flagstaff, AZ
HONORS:
1990: 1994: Recipient of the American Heart Association Established Investigatorship Award
Recipient of Irvine H. Page Award from the American Heart Association
1993: Member, NIH Pathology A Study Section
PUBLICATIONS: Selected from a total of 19 articles and 24 abstracts
Articles:
1. Dyer, C.A., Erickson, G.F., and Curtiss, L.K. Functional heterogeneity in the ability of high density lipoproteins to enhance gonadotropin-induced androgen production in cultured rat theca-interstitial cells. In: Lipoprotein and Cholesterol Metabolism in Steroidogenic Tissues, edited by J. Strauss and K. Menon. George F. Stickley Co., Philadelphia, PA, 1985, pp. 141-146.
2. Dyer, C.A., and Erickson, G.F. Norepinephrine amplifies human chorionic gonadotropin stimulated androgen biosynthesis by ovarian theca-interstitial cells. Endocrinology, 116:1645, 1985.
3. Wiklund, O., Dyer, C.A., Tsao, B.P., and Curtiss, L.K. Stoichiometric binding of apolipoprotein B-specific monoclonal antibodies to low density lipoproteins. J. Biol. Chem., 260:10956-10960, 1985.
4. Erickson, G.F., Magoffin, D.A., Dyer, C.A., and Hofeditz, C. The ovarian androgen producing cells: A review of structure/function relationships. Endo. Rev., 6:371, 1985.
5. Snyder, F.F., Dyer, C., Seegmiller, J.E., Goldblum, R.M., Mills, G.C., and Schmalstieg, F.C. Substrate inhibition of adenosine phosphorylation in adenosine deaminase deficiency and adenosine-mediated inhibition of PP-Ribose-P dependent nucleotide synthesis in hypoxanthine phosphoribosyltransferase deficient erythrocytes. J. Inher. Metab. Dis., 11:174-183, 1988.
6. Dyer, C.A., and Curtiss, L.K. Apoprotein E-rich high density lipoproteins inhibit ovarian androgen synthesis. J. Biol. Chem., 263:10965-10973, 1988.
7. Takagi, Y., Dyer, C.A., and Curtiss, L.K. Platelet-enhanced apolipoprotein E production by human macrophages: A possible role in atherosclerosis. J. Lipid Res., 29:859-867, 1988.
8. Curtiss, L.K., Dyer, C.A., Banka, C.L., and Black, A.S. Platelet-mediated foam cell formation in atherosclerosis. Clin. Invest. Med., 13:189-195, 1990.
